XMLTV Schedules Direct False Downloaders: An XMLTV installation based on Debian with a JSON added grabber for Shedules Direct. [br]This allows use of Schedules Direct for all supported countries.[br] XMLTV is a set of programs to process TV (tvguide) listings and manage your TV viewing, storing listings in an XML format.[br] The JSON grabber provided is tv_grab_sd_json. At the moment the images uses the latest version on GitHub, but it has very recently been officially accepted into XMLTV codebase.[br] Provides an XMLTV installation with a JSON schedules direct script installed.
This is a template with pass through of all your DVB Tuners.[br] Tvheadend is a TV streaming server. It's possible to pass through a DVB adapter. Instructions on how to do that is in the support thread. It is compiled with support for HDHomerun.[br] http://tvheadend.org[br] [b][span style=\'color: #E80000;\']Directions:[/span][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] : This is where XMLTV will store it\'s cache and configuration.[br][br] [b]/data[/b] : This is the output directory for the EPG data that has been scrapped.[br][br] Eeek!.[br][br] [b][span style='color: #E80000;']Directions:[/span][/b][br] [b]/config[/b] : in this path, Home Assistant will store it's configuration files.

// talk about variables supported // features -- auto runs a grab on startup, with it's own day count i.e. STARTUPDAYS -- specify the number of days used when running the grabber script with DAYS -- specify the offset used with running the grabber script with OFFSET -- specify the grabber used with GRABBER. It will default to tv_grab_sd_json if not specified.
// custom cron jobs At the moment there is a scan that runs at such a time, however, support is enabled to allow custom cron schedules. Just edit the crontab.txt file in the config directory and restart.
